item.title: Hourly Contracting
item.dc:creator: j.smalls
item.content:encoded:
Hourly Contracting

Some times the business need has a known start, and end. It is not continuous enough to justify a support contract, but not not large enough to justify full project management. In this case SmallTech offers hourly contracting rates to fulfill your need for your small project.

item.title: Cost Structure
item.dc:creator: j.smalls
item.content:encoded:
SmallTech offers a number of solutions for building, and managing your image online.

Project Management

Project management best suits the needs of a business, that wants to completely rebrand their online presence, or launch a signficantly important new feature, or product. Project management candidates often require launching a new, or redesigned web domain, and developing a mobile application.

Support Contracts

Once the project has launched, it will require ongoing support. While it may fulfill its originally stated goal, business needs evolve. Customers may request new features, new content, and UI alterations. Software, and web sites that we publish online are living documents, that must be monitored, and respond to the changing business climate.

Hourly Contracting

Some times the business need has a known start, and end. It is not continuous enough to justify a support contract, but not not large enough to justify full project management. In this case SmallTech offers hourly contracting rates to fulfill your need for your small project.

item.title: Support Contracts
item.dc:creator: j.smalls
item.content:encoded:
Support Contracts

Once the project has launched, it will require ongoing support. While it may fulfill its originally stated goal, business needs evolve. Customers may request new features, new content, and UI alterations. Software, and web sites that we publish online are living documents, that must be monitored, and respond to the changing business climate.
Outsourcing a support contract offers significant cost savings versus direct employment of a skilled technician, especially for smaller businesses with fewer technical needs. However it also provides the chance to address your online needs right away rather than ignoring them, and forgoing the opportunity cost of operating at your greatest efficiency.

Web Development

The first step toward a turning page views into client interaction is having an attractive, and lean web site for your users to land on. As the your audience matures, and grows, so must your site. The means maintaining up the the display as we add new content to maximize its visual appeal. This also means keeping up with the latest web practices to deliver cleaner, faster, more coherent content for readers, and web browsers.
  • Pages Cost
  • Small 1 - 20 $200 monthly
  • Midsize 21 - 500 $1000 monthly
  • Large 500+ $3000 monthly

Remote Technical Support

The back bone of any business is delivering an excellent product at market rates, the muscle is the people on your team, and your work stations are your tools. You can do a job with just the right product, right people, but it is exceptionally easier with the right tools. SmallTech works with you to keep all of your technology functioning smoothly, and inutuively so that your people can make the most of every work day.
  • Work Stations Cost
  • Small 1 - 5 $200 monthly
  • Midsize 6 - 15 $1000 monthly
  • External $5000 monthly

item.title: Web
item.dc:creator: j.smalls
item.content:encoded: The marketing strategy for any modern company begins, and ends on the web. Your web presence is the first resource that your customers consult before buying from your business. They will use it to find every thing from your business hours, and contact information to details of your products, and services offered. Your online presences extends beyond the site under your control though: ratings sites like Yelp, local news articles, social media outlets all also turn up in search results for your brand. While the basis of a strong company will always be an excellent product, the next element is a coherent web presence: memorable URL, thoughtful content, and well managed third party references.

item.title: Project Management
item.dc:creator: j.smalls
item.content:encoded:
Project Management

Project management best suits the needs of a business, that wants to completely rebrand their online presence, or launch a signficantly important new feature, or product. Project management candidates often require launching a new, or redesigned web domain, and developing a mobile application.
When your business needs to take full control of a project, no thing beats professional project management. SmallTech will work with you from the initial inquiry to the last hand shake at launch to ensure that your project is a resounding success, and meets your goals.
Since every project is different, every project requires a custom price quote. Please complete the inquiry form below for the initial specifications of your project to help us gain a sense of your project needs.
[contact-form-7 id="81" title="Project Specification Inquiry"]

item.title: Trauma Stewardship Institute
item.dc:creator: j.smalls
item.content:encoded:
SmallTech worked with Trauma Stewardship Institute as a subcontractor for another developer. The project was specifically custom theme design for their site. The designer sent a series of Photoshop files to illustrate how the site was supposed to look, and we created the site based on that.

Although the site consists primarily of several pages, we was able to simplify it into three page themes. Once we had designed the theme files, creating the site simply a matter of populating the content onto each page, and styling it to their preferences.

  • Trauma Stewardship Institute

  • Industry: nonprofit
  • Location: Seattle WA
  • Size: 1 - 10 employees
  • Tech: Wordpress
  • Project: site development

item.title: Green Street Studios
item.dc:creator: j.smalls
item.content:encoded:
A different designer built the theme for this site. It had some early issues, including a Wordpress SQL error that rendered the entire site blank. Green Street brought SmallTech on to support it, so our responsibility has primarily been ensuring its proper function at all times. This includes improving its fault tolerance with backup versions of the site, and fulfilling requests to adjust its display, and functionality.

  • Green Street Studios

  • Industry: community organization
  • Location: Cambridge MA
  • Size: 1 - 10 employees
  • Technology: Wordpress
    Nginx
    Sass
    git
    AWS
  • Project: site administration

item.title: Mass Challenge
item.dc:creator: j.smalls
item.content:encoded:
SmallTech supports an on site, full time developer in maintaining MassChallenge.org. This site is built on Drupal, and is their primary mechanism for delivering news, and services to their competition participants.

Site administration for MassChallenge means doing absolutely any thing, and every thing. The assigned task could be as simple as a content migration, and publishing to some thing as complex as deploying a reservation management system. Typically this involves a mix of using both the Drupal UI, and raw PHP / MySQL scripting in template files, and modules.

  • MassChallenge

  • Industry: nonprofit
  • Location: Boston MA
  • Size: 1 - 10 employees
  • Technology: Drupal
    git
    Acquia
    Sass
    JQuery
  • Project: site administration

item.title: Search Engine Optimization
item.dc:creator: j.smalls
item.content:encoded:
Search engine optimization ( SEO ) can be a dirty word in the world of web development simply because of some of the practices with which it has become associated. In times past SEO meant gaming search results through different forms of junk content that mostly amounted to key word stuffing, and cloaking text . While these can be temporarily effective, search engines are in the full time business of improving their algorithms to defeat practices like these.

Proper SEO has two elements to it: high quality content, and well designed code, and server architecture. While the quality of content is subjective, the quality of the underlying code is not. Simpler, faster executing pages will rank higher than their more sluggish competition. One of the challenges for a technologist is ensuring that it works as intended, but the next is optimizing its execution. A good developer will likely find ways to improve the load times of your pages on each retouching, or better complete the mark up to faciliatate indexing my search engines. This is one area where a site owner should not try to skimp on costs, because the time invested in improving the quality of the page will increase returns over its life.
Local Search
Planning for search engine traffic can have the greatest relative effect on small businesses because of the way the internet democratizes advertising. Independent, and regional businesses may never be able to compete with national brands for television, and print media, but all are equal within our own web domains. We have seen consistently that those businesses most invested in publishing detailed content will rank higher in search engines.

Brick, and mortar businesses also benefit from much more specific searches. A person will search for "gardening" when he wants general information on the practice, but "gardening Boston MA" when he wants to find gardening supplies, gardening organizations, or gardening services for near term purchase.

item.title: Social Media
item.dc:creator: j.smalls
item.content:encoded:
Social media can be a powerful tool in generating attention for your brand, but it can also be a huge distraction. The impulse to continously stream new content through social media outlets can be very tempting when we see statistics of how successful others may have been at it, but we also need to be wary of the associated advertising costs, and the different needs of every business.

One of the easiest traps to fall into with social media is pushing content onto their sites without consideration of when, or how we might see a concrete benefit. Experience has shown that users go to social media sites to read news about their friends, and connections. Where we are able to insert our selves into their feeds, the typical result is that the readers will momentarily read our post, identify it as marketing, and gloss over it. At that point we have used our content to enrich the owners of the social media site without necessarily deriving any benefit for our selves, and this is contrary to our goal of calling them to action, and leveraging the massive audiences in social media sites into customers for our enterprises.

The trick is to be just as strategic about social media as we are about the other elements of our marketing. That means a number of things:
  • being selective about what networks we use to target our intended audience, and recognizing what frame of mind their users are in. For instance Facebook, and Twitter users may be most interested in short, amusing content, or direct communication with their friends while CraigsList users are much more active shoppers, and sellers.
  • using our excellent content to draw traffic away from the social media sites, and into our businesses. The best, most active social media campaign is useless, if readers simply gloss over it, and continue to read different content on the same site. We want to initiate an action that directly benefits your business, whether that be a page view, a sale, or a referral, or a lead.

item.title: Managing Page Layout
item.dc:creator: j.smalls
item.content:encoded: While load speed is an important factor in delivering maximum content to your visitors in the shortest amount of time, Jakob Nielsen shows that we should pay special attention to the patterns that users may have already developed when designing pages for the web. Namely users consistently scan the page for interesting content before deciding whether to read in depth, or move on. The visual appeal of the content in your natural F shaped block can make the difference between a sale, or a bounce on your pages. Even the best, most compelling content still requires that viewers stay on the page long enough to read it.
